description: Prove the famous Basel Problem: 1/1² + 1/2² + 1/3² + 1/4² + ... = π²/6. This stunning result was solved by Euler in 1734. Start by showing the infinite sum ∑(1/n²) from n=1 to infinity. Show the first few terms: 1 + 1/4 + 1/9 + 1/16 + ... and their partial sums converging. Then reveal the shocking answer: this equals π²/6 ≈ 1.6449. Display the beautiful final equation with a box around it. Add text explaining this connects an infinite sum of rationals to the transcendental number π². Use elegant typography for the mathematical expressions.
